intro: Orthaea brachysiphon, commonly known as the narrow-siphon orthaea, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Orthaea brachysiphon is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
